name: operating
content:
operating adjective [before noun]
(BUSINESS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
business
  specialized relating to the main business activities of a company: The membership fees are enough to cover the operating costs of the health club. The company aims to make at least £100 million in operating profits in its next financial year.
More examplesFewer examplesThe business had an operating loss of $165 million.Operating expenses such as utilities, insurance, and repairs are tax deductible.The group's operating budget is around $100 million.

operating adjective [before noun]
(FUNCTIONING)
working or being used: We went to visit an operating windmill. It was the last operating machine of its kind until it broke down last year.
More examplesFewer examplesThe show is being broadcast on the last operating TV station in the country.An operating fusion reactor would work a little below ignition condition.The company required its franchisees to purchase an operating restaurant and run it for at least a year before expanding.
